TopicTitle: Stock Super Compact Bearing made from fairings!

Articles.Content:
Hi fellow kerbonauts,

For the past few days I experimented upon various bearing designs for my upcoming Rail Gun 6's Revolver Type Cartridge.

After many trial and error tests, I have finally perfected the **s** **trongest**, most compact and most efficient bearing ever made!

> 
> ![1dnmdaO.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/1dnmdaO.jpg)
> 
>  ![B3xT0fS.png](http://i.imgur.com/B3xT0fS.png)
> 
> ![tgtLtoT.png](http://i.imgur.com/tgtLtoT.png)
> 
> 

> 
> 1. press space to undock
> 
> 2. then press '[' or ']' to cycle to the bearing, 
> 
> 3. Control rotation by pressing the keys 'e' or 'q' to spin the bearing!
> 
> 

> 
> Craft file:[https://www.dropbox.com/s/a8yt9it055weoqk/FB2.craft?dl=0](https://www.dropbox.com/s/a8yt9it055weoqk/FB2.craft?dl=0)
> 
> Subassembly:[https://www.dropbox.com/s/b4vxg5yih7q02vc/Fairing%20Bearing.craft?dl=0](https://www.dropbox.com/s/b4vxg5yih7q02vc/Fairing%20Bearing.craft?dl=0)

actually, the wheel physical collider don't match entirely the wheel's 3d model ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif) (plus, the fairings are still not 'round' - it's still a 3d model / 3d physical collider ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif) so having the wheels slightly retracted from the fairings can sometime improve the stability of the thing ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

if you want to test the durability of your bearings under stress, you can use a test rig similar to what i did to test my turbofans : starting from a standard fuel tank (you can suspend it with launch clamps), you add a series (10 to 12) round-8 toroidal fuel tank, a part onto which you can surface mount thing (used a probe core, because my turbofans did not have probe cores once the bearing was decoupled). onto this part, add 4 I-beams (with symmetry) and add vernors at the end of each i-beam. finally, add your bearing (+ whatever you attach to it ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)) attached underneath this last part. once you decouple your bearing and make it turn, switch back to the test apparatus, and start giving RCS roll impulses in various directions ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif) the round-8's tanks very elastic points will allow you to give mean impulses to your bearing ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

[![OvfOhAxl.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/OvfOhAxl.jpg)](http://imgur.com/OvfOhAx)

if that don't jam your bearing, not a lot of thing will be able to do it ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

> 
> Pretty neat, but raises two questions:
> 1) why doesn't stock have bearing parts
> 
> 2) what would bearings have use for?

@xyphos free bearings can allow a lot of neat things ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif) (their main use is generally for helicopter rotors / aircraft props) - now, those free bearings made of fairings have the only flaw that they are two separate crafts once decoupled - so we can't use on rail time acceleration (only physical acceleration works - on rail time acceleration don't have physics kick in, so one part, being on a slightly different orbit than the other part - and they would move apart clipping through each other with on rail time acceleration) - a stock free bearing would allow us to keep 1 single craft instead of having two parts - which would allow us to easily create stock centrifuge space stations - and be able to use time acceleration with it.

however, more than bearings, we could really use small hinges in stock; as there can be a lot of articulated parts on a satellite (granted, they are generally only used once, to deploy antennas and solar panels) but it would allow us to 'pack' a big satellite (once deployed) inside a small fairing. (think something like the James Webb Space Telescope, where the hexagonal mirrors sections are deployed after the satellite is in space - because that huge thing would not be able to be packed inside Ariane V fairing without hinged parts ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif))
